column4: can someone help me it seems that my ubuntu cant sudo but it can su -c
use visudo to edit the /etc/sudoers file
im using a vanilla hoary everything seems fidn except the ~fqdn, shoudl i remove it?
you need to edit the sudoers file with visudo
how it says im not root
hmm - you disabled root as well?
if u tell what to edit ill reboot into my other distro and change it
ya
you are in fairly deep ###
ill reboot into another distro and ill brb
you can try booting with init=/bin/bash and editing /etc/sudoers, but I don't know if it will work
i can now edit teh file
cool
the last lien says root  ALL=(ALL) ALL
what should it be?
user ALL=(ALL) ALL
thx
I hope you used visudo - it will tell you if you stuffed up
yes i did and now ill restart
thank you very much it worked
cool - you're welcome :)
